data.title: Possibility of an Island (2008)
data.meta_description: La Possibilité d'une île is a 2008 film directed by Michel Houellebecq, loosely based on his 2005 novel The Possibility of an Island.
data.text:
A mysterious sci-fi film that culminates Hoellebecq’s fascination with the idea of a trans humanist technology arising from a dedicated group of Raelian-like alien cultists. As I remeber it, a variation of this group showed up in two, possibly three of his books as smaller background players in his nihilistic comedies of sex and suffering, before coming to full focus in his novel that he himself adapted to film here.

The book split its time between its protagonist, Daniel’s 20th/21st century life, made up of the kind of lonliness and pointless void filling fans of H’s work enjoy his insights into, a strangely detached world of future Daniels, reviewing his diary entries from the perspective of their improved emotional and…
